news.title: Akzo Nobel India net profit dips 31.58% in Q3 FY26, to be renamed JSW Dulux
news.para: Akzo Nobel India saw its net profit drop by over 31% in the quarter ending December 31, 2025. JSW Paints completed the acquisition of a majority stake in the company on December 10, 2025. Following this, the company's board approved a name change to JSW Dulux.

news.title: Awfis Space Solutions' net profit up 42.72% in Q3 FY26
news.para: Awfis Space Solutions' net consolidated profit surged by 42.72 percent in the quarter ending December 31, 2025. Total income also saw a significant rise. The companyexpanded its network by adding ten new centers.

news.title: MHADA to sell 120 unsold flats in Mumbai on first-come-first-served basis from February 5
news.para: Mumbai Housing and Area Development Board, MHADA, will sell 120 unsold residential flats.  These units are available on a first-come-first-served basis. Online registrations open on February 5, 2026.  Flat selection and payment processes begin February 12, 2026.

news.title: Nexus Select Trust declares ₹359 crore distribution to unitholders for Q3 FY26
news.para: Nexus Select Trust will distribute Rs 358.60 crore to its unitholders for the quarter ending December 2025. The real estate investment trust reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 139.40 crore for the October-December period. Total income also rose to Rs 691.93 crore.

news.title: SC upholds insolvency proceedings against real estate firms for Greater Noida project
news.para: The Supreme Court has affirmed the initiation of insolvency proceedings against Bhasin Infotech and Grand Venezia. This ruling stands as a firm defense of the rights of both homebuyers and commercial investors, highlighting the developers' failure to deliver promised functional units and their misleading communications.

news.title: Bajaj Housing Finance's net profit rises 21.10% in Q3 FY26
news.para: Bajaj Housing Finance announced a significant 21.10 percent jump in its net profit for the quarter ending December 31, 2025. The company's profit after tax reached ₹664.89 crore. Total income also saw a healthy rise of 17.85 percent.

news.title: Mahindra Lifespace Developers posts net profit of ₹108.88 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: Mahindra Lifespace Developers has announced strong financial results for the quarter ending December 31, 2025. The company reported a net profit of ₹108.88 crore, a turnaround from a loss in the previous year. Total income also saw a substantial increase of over 150 percent.

news.title: Secunderabad Cantonment residents submit ward-wise house tax arrears recovery proposal
news.para: Residents of Ward-8, Secunderabad Cantonment, have proposed a ward-wise tax arrears recovery plan to authorities. The initiative calls for stricter, legally structured enforcement of overdue house tax collections under the Cantonments Act 2006, including fortnightly drives and escalation against chronic defaulters.

news.title: Pune civic body proposes 10% hike in property tax, citizens’ groups question move
news.para: Pune Municipal Corporation proposes a 10% property tax hike to boost revenue, facing opposition from citizens' groups who urge recovery of Rs 7,000 crore in dues from defaulters. Officials cite limited revenue options post-Octroi abolition and highlight recent amnesty scheme success in recovering Rs 713 crore.

news.title: Haryana affordable housing scheme stalled in NCR cities amid rising land, construction costs
news.para: Affordable housing initiatives in Gurugram and Faridabad are currently at a standstill. The surging costs associated with land and construction have made existing price structures impractical for developers to comply with. Meanwhile, residents eagerly anticipate new housing alternatives.

news.title: Chennai: Residents oppose ban on building permits near Pallikaranai marsh
news.para: Thoraipakkam residents protested the CMDA's decision to halt building permits within a 1km radius of Pallikaranai marshland. Over 200 participants urged the government to review the circular, which affects owners of approved plots and patta lands, impacting loans and future construction. They demanded encroachment removal instead of restrictions on approved areas.

news.title: Soon, you can get your land conversion sanad online in Goa
news.para: Goa government is set to issue conversion sanads online, eliminating the need for physical visits to revenue offices. Draft rules for the Goa Land Revenue (Conversion of Use of Land and Non-Agricultural Assessment) (Amendment) Rules, 2025, have been released for public feedback.

news.title: Karnataka home minister directs police to investigate circumstances that led to Confident Group's chairperson suicide
news.para: Police are investigating the death of Confident Group chairperson C J Roy. Roy allegedly shot himself in his office while Income Tax officials were present. The Home Minister has directed a thorough inquiry into the incident. Roy's family has linked his death to the Income Tax department's actions.

news.title: Budget 2026 allocates ₹20,000 crore for carbon capture push across cement, steel and power sectors
news.para: The Union Budget 2026-27 earmarks ₹20,000 crore for pioneering Carbon Capture technologies over the next five years. Focusing on essential sectors like cement and steel, this initiative is a critical stride in India's mission to achieve net-zero emissions by 2070.

news.title: Budget 2026: Govt to accelerate CPSE real estate monetisation through dedicated REITs
news.para: In the Union Budget 2026, FM Sitharaman proposes dedicated REITs to accelerate monetisation and recycling of CPSE-owned real estate assets.

news.title: Bengaluru development body’s corner site woes: Buyers complain of two-fold tax
news.para: BDA's slab-based property tax policy is drawing criticism from owners of irregularly-sized plots. These allottees claim they are unfairly penalized, paying nearly double the tax on their entire sites for just a few extra square meters. They argue only the excess area should attract higher rates, not the whole plot.

news.title: Budget 2026: REIT push, land acquisition relief and city-led growth boost real estate sector
news.para: The Union Budget 2026-27 introduces key initiatives for real estate and construction. It plans to monetize central public sector enterprise assets through REITs. A scheme will enhance construction equipment manufacturing. Tax exemptions are provided for compulsory land acquisition. Urban development in Tier II and Tier III cities receives a significant boost.

news.title: Budget 2026: Government to accelerate recycling of CPSE real estate assets through REITs
news.para: The Indian government will boost efforts to monetize real estate owned by public sector companies. This will be done using dedicated Real Estate Investment Trusts. This move aims to unlock value from public assets and generate revenue. It will also help channel institutional capital into infrastructure.

news.title: BDA layout residents set to join Greater Bengaluru authority’s democratic fold
news.para: Residents of several long-neglected BDA layouts in Bengaluru are set to gain democratic participation as the government initiates their handover to the Greater Bengaluru Authority (GBA). This move will bring these areas under elected representation, structured municipal budgets, and grievance redressal mechanisms, promising improved civic governance and accountability for residents who have long awaited recognition within the city's administrative system.

news.title: Hyderabad: Over 15 lakh sq yards of TDR available with GHMC, mandatory use for high-rises raises costs
news.para: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation holds over 15 lakh sq yards of TDRs worth ₹2,000 crore, sufficient for the city's built-up demand for the next two to three years. A new rule mandates 10% TDR utilization for high-rises above 10 floors, aiming to benefit TDR holders amidst rising land acquisition costs.
